alert.note: Alert for Spink (South Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Aberdeen (Northern and Northeastern South Dakota)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 11 at 7:58AM MDT until further notice by NWS Aberdeen
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following river in South Dakota... James River At Ashton affecting Spink County. James River near Stratford affecting Brown and Spink Counties. James River At Columbia affecting Brown County. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Major flooding is occurring and major flooding is forecast. * WHERE...James River At Ashton. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 16.5 feet, The water overtops the bridge 3 miles north and 1 1/2 mile east of Ashton * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:45 AM CDT Saturday the stage was 17.4 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:45 AM CDT Saturday was 17.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to remain steady above flood stage at 17.4 feet. - Flood stage is 13.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/abr. The next statement will be issued Wednesday.
